citation.article-title: Proposal of Yaniellaceae fam. nov., Yaniella gen. nov. and Sinobaca gen. nov. as replacements for the illegitimate prokaryotic names Yaniaceae Li et al. 2005, Yania Li et al. 2004, emend Li et al. 2005, and Sinococcus Li et al. 2006, respectively.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sinobaca (Si.no.ba′ca. M.L. n. Sina China; L. fem. n. baca a grain or berry, and in bacteriology a coccus; N.L. fem. n. Sinobaca coccus-shaped microbe isolated from places in China).
Previous illegitimate name: Sinococcus Li et al. 2006.
The description of the genus is as given for Sinococcus in Li et al. (2006).
The type species is Sinobaca qinghaiensis (Li et al., 2006).
